workflow.name: Analyze social media sentiment & trends from Twitter & Facebook using GPT-4o
workflow.description:
## Description
 Gain real-time audience intelligence with this cross-platform AI Sentiment Analyzer for Twitter (X) and Facebook. üìäüß†
 This workflow consolidates mentions and comments, performs GPT-4o-powered sentiment and keyword analysis, summarizes audience mood, highlights dominant trends, and sends a polished HTML report via email ‚Äî all automatically. Ideal for marketing and insights teams tracking brand conversations across social platforms. üöÄüí¨

## What This Template Does
 1Ô∏è‚É£ Starts manually to fetch the latest Twitter mentions and Facebook post comments. üïπÔ∏è
 2Ô∏è‚É£ Merges both datasets into a unified JSON structure for seamless cross-platform analysis. üß©
 3Ô∏è‚É£ Validates incoming API data to ensure completeness before processing. ‚úÖ
 4Ô∏è‚É£ Runs a custom JavaScript transformation to normalize all messages and add sentiment placeholders. üß†
 5Ô∏è‚É£ Uses GPT-4o to perform sentiment and keyword trend analysis, returning structured JSON insights. üìà
 6Ô∏è‚É£ Parses AI output to extract overall sentiment ratios and detailed post-level analysis. üîç
 7Ô∏è‚É£ Generates a human-readable HTML summary using GPT-4o ‚Äî featuring emojis, bullet insights, and trend sections. üé®
 8Ô∏è‚É£ Emails the formatted sentiment report directly to the marketing team. ‚úâÔ∏è
 9Ô∏è‚É£ Logs API or runtime errors automatically into Google Sheets for transparent monitoring. üßæ

## Key Benefits
 ‚úÖ Provides an automated end-to-end pipeline for sentiment intelligence.
 ‚úÖ Centralizes Twitter and Facebook audience data in one workflow.
 ‚úÖ Delivers structured insights ready for dashboards or client reporting.
 ‚úÖ Generates branded HTML summaries that are ready for emailing.
 ‚úÖ Improves reliability with built-in error tracking and validation layers.

## Features
- Dual-platform integration (Twitter X API + Facebook Graph API).
- JavaScript logic for merging and normalizing social datasets.
- GPT-4o-based sentiment classification and keyword extraction.
- Structured JSON parsing and visualization pipeline.
- AI-generated HTML summary reports for presentation and sharing.
- Automated email dispatch via Gmail.
- Google Sheets logging for audit and debugging.
- Modular configuration ‚Äî easily extendable to other social networks.

#3 Requirements
- Twitter OAuth2 credentials for fetching mentions.
- Facebook Graph API credentials for reading posts and comments.
- Azure OpenAI (GPT-4o) credentials for sentiment and summary generation.
- Gmail OAuth2 credentials for automated email delivery.
- Google Sheets OAuth2 credentials for error logging and tracking.

## Environment Variables
- TWITTER_API_KEY
- FACEBOOK_GRAPH_TOKEN
- AZURE_OPENAI_API_KEY
- GMAIL_REPORT_RECIPIENTS
- GOOGLE_SHEET_ERROR_LOG_ID

## Target Audience
 üìà Marketing and insights teams monitoring audience engagement.
 üí¨ Social media managers analyzing public sentiment.
 üß† Data analysts exploring brand perception trends.
 üí° PR and communications teams managing online reputation.
 üßæ Operations or automation teams integrating AI analytics into dashboards.

## Step-by-Step Setup Instructions
 1Ô∏è‚É£ Connect all API credentials ‚Äî Twitter, Facebook Graph, Azure OpenAI, Gmail, and Google Sheets.
 2Ô∏è‚É£ Update your Twitter user ID and Facebook Page ID in the respective nodes.
 3Ô∏è‚É£ Confirm the merge and validation logic in the Merge Platform Datasets and Validate API Response nodes.
 4Ô∏è‚É£ Check that your Azure OpenAI account has GPT-4o access enabled.
 5Ô∏è‚É£ Verify the Gmail recipient and test the ‚ÄúSend Email Summary‚Äù node for delivery.
 6Ô∏è‚É£ Link your Google Sheet with a tab named error log sheet to capture workflow exceptions.
 7Ô∏è‚É£ Run the workflow once manually to validate each layer ‚Äî data, AI response, email delivery.
 8Ô∏è‚É£ Optionally, schedule it to run daily or weekly for automated sentiment insights. ‚úÖ

workflow.name: AI-Powered Cross-Platform Audience Sentiment & Trend Analyzer

options.systemMessage:
=You are a social media analytics assistant.

Your job is to analyze combined social media mentions, comments, and posts across platforms such as Twitter (X) and Facebook.

Given an input dataset of social posts and comments, you must:
1. Perform **sentiment analysis** on each item (positive / negative / neutral).
2. Extract **key topics, themes, or keywords** mentioned.
3. Identify **top recurring trends** across all items.
4. Calculate **overall sentiment distribution** (e.g., 60% positive, 20% negative, 20% neutral).
5. Return the output as clean, structured JSON.

Ensure your analysis is concise, data-driven, and easy to visualize later.
Avoid repeating text or adding unnecessary narrative.

nodes.name: Parse AI Output to Structured JSON

parameters.text:
=You are a professional marketing insights writer who transforms structured analytical data into clean, visually engaging reports. 

Your task is to summarize social media sentiment data and engagement trends in a polished and human-readable tone.  

Focus on:
1. Highlighting positive, negative, and neutral sentiment proportions with short insights.
2. Extracting top recurring topics or keywords and summarizing what they indicate about audience mood.
3. Giving 3‚Äì5 bullet-point insights about the overall tone of discussion (what people liked, disliked, and discussed the most).
4. Mentioning key examples from the dataset when useful (e.g., ‚ÄúUsers praised the movie excitement and visuals.‚Äù)
5. Keeping formatting clean with short paragraphs, emojis, and clear section titles (use Markdown headings like **Overall Summary**, **Top Trends**, **Insights**, etc.)

Return your response in **HTML format**, suitable for an email body, with light styling (headers, bold text, lists, and emojis).
Avoid adding JSON or code blocks ‚Äî just return clean HTML.

nodes.name: Send Email Summary to Marketing Team

parameters.content:
## Cross-Platform Audience Sentiment Analyzer üéØ
This workflow unifies data from Twitter (X) and Facebook, performs AI-driven sentiment and keyword analysis, and delivers structured marketing summaries by email.  
It provides real-time insight into audience tone, trending topics, and engagement behavior across both platforms.

### Key Steps:
1Ô∏è‚É£ Fetch mentions from Twitter and comments from Facebook.  
2Ô∏è‚É£ Merge both datasets into a unified comment structure.  
3Ô∏è‚É£ Run sentiment and keyword extraction using GPT-4o.  
4Ô∏è‚É£ Summarize audience mood and top trends in HTML format.  
5Ô∏è‚É£ Email the final report to the marketing team automatically.  
6Ô∏è‚É£ Log API or runtime errors into Google Sheets for monitoring.

### Setup Checklist:
- Connect credentials: Twitter, Facebook Graph, Azure OpenAI, Gmail, Google Sheets.  
- Verify Gmail and Google Sheet IDs.  
- Adjust API endpoints to your preferred handles or pages.  
- Optionally schedule a weekly run for automated social insights.

## Data Collection Layer
Fetches recent mentions from Twitter (X) and recent post comments from Facebook.  
Provides raw input data for sentiment and trend analysis across both platforms.

## Dataset Merging
Combines results from both APIs into a unified dataset.  
Ensures consistent structure for message text, timestamps, reactions, and likes.

## Data Validation
Checks API responses to confirm essential fields exist before analysis.  
Invalid or empty responses are sent to Google Sheets for error tracking.

## Data Consolidation
Standardizes and merges Facebook comments and Twitter mentions into a clean JSON array.  
Adds key attributes like platform, author, sentiment placeholder, and post URLs.

## AI Sentiment & Keyword Analysis
Uses GPT-4o to classify each post/comment as Positive, Negative, or Neutral.  
Extracts recurring themes and dominant keywords to detect engagement trends.

## AI Output Parsing
Cleans and parses the AI output JSON.  
Extracts sentiment distribution, topic keywords, and detailed message-level analysis for downstream summarization.

## AI Summary Generation
GPT-4o converts structured data into a visually rich HTML summary.  
Includes sentiment ratios, trending topics, and top insights formatted for email readability.

## Email Delivery
Sends the final HTML summary via Gmail to marketing stakeholders.  
Includes formatted sections with emojis and highlights for quick readability.

## Error Logging
Captures workflow or API-level errors and logs them in Google Sheets.  
Provides an audit trail for debugging and workflow reliability.

main.node: Send Email Summary to Marketing Team
Parse AI Output to Structured JSON

user.bio: Rahul Joshi is a seasoned technology leader specializing in the n8n automation tool and AI-driven workflow automation. With deep expertise in building open-source workflow automation and self-hosted automation platforms, he helps organizations eliminate manual processes through intelligent n8n ai agent automation solutions.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
